page.title: 10Contact Magazine
page.content: The Hornby area is fortunate to have its own magazine to inform the inhabitants of current affairs within the area. About 14 years ago Mr. Bob Beetham thought it would be a good idea to supply every house with information concerning forthcoming events so that it would avoid more than one event being held on the same day. Today the magazine includes not only information for one's diary, but also "lost and found", "for sale and wanted" adverts., reports of events which have recently been held and a separate pull-out section which contains all the church news and reports. Two ladies in the village are responsible for compiling the monthly editions which take a day to type and duplicate. 430 copies are printed All but 24 are delivered to homes; these are sold at the Post Office, price 5p.
